item.title: Kevin Warsh went from selling racetrack pencils to Trump’s new Fed chair pick. His advice for Gen Z: Merit is the ultimate currency in the workplace
item.description: Before Wall Street and Washington, Kevin Warsh sold pencils at a horse track. His secret for success is simple: work harder than everyone else—and lea...

item.title: The new Fed chair’s billionaire father-in-law is a friend of Trump’s from college and has business interests in Greenland
item.description: Trump’s pick of Kevin Warsh pairs an inflation hawk with a deep Trumpworld connection through Ronald Lauder, a friend to the president for 60 years.

item.title: Exclusive: Long-time Google DeepMind researcher David Silver leaves to found his own AI startup
item.description: Silver's new startup Ineffable Intelligence will focus on developing 'superintelligence' using the same AI methods that led to Google DeepMind breakth...

item.title: Tech CFOs face a new challenge: Selling unprecedented capex as ‘disciplined’
item.description: Meta and Microsoft CFOs frame AI spending as disciplined, demand-driven.

item.title: Trump expands trade war with Canada, threatening 50% aircraft tariff
item.description: The president said he was retaliating against Canada for refusing to certify jets from Savannah, Georgia-based Gulfstream Aerospace.
